title: Teen shot by Salinas police ID'd
content:
The person fatally shot by Salinas police during an incident early Wednesday morning has been identified as 16-year-old Marlon Joel Rodas-Sanchez, according to the Monterey County District Attorney’s Office.
The DA’s office is investigating the officer-involved shooting, as recommended in a Department of Justice review of Salinas police, and the parents of the teen have agreed to release his name, according to a statement from the DA’s office.
Around 1:30 a.m. Wednesday, Salinas police responded to reports of a juvenile wielding a knife in the 600 block of Terrace Street. The teen was reportedly sharpening the knife across a concrete sidewalk.
Responding officers tried to disarm the teen using fire hoses, rubber bullets and Tasers over the course of about an hour, but all of it was ineffective, said Ed Hazel, Managing Deputy District Attorney.
Officers then chased him into a residence where the teen reportedly turned and charged the officers, and they opened fire on him. Officers were unclear at the time whether the residence was occupied or not, Hazel said.
The DA’s Office is now reviewing evidence, witness statements, body camera footage, toxicology and autopsy reports, as they continue the investigation. Once completed, the DA’s Office will publicly release its findings.
It will likely take about six to eight weeks for toxicology reports to come back, and it may take two to three months for the DA to complete its report, Hazel said.
